oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Plaintiffs' brief in Mapp v. Board of Education of Chattanooga, 1965 May 10
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Bell, Derrick A.; Greenberg, Jack; Looby, Z. Alexander; Williams, Avon N.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Brief submitted to the United States District Court for the Eastern District of Tennessee by attorneys for James Mapp, outlines the history of desegregation in Chattanooga public schools and demands full and complete integration.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Mapp v. Board of Education of Chattanooga; Segregation in education -- Law and legislation; Segregation in education -- Tennessee -- Chattanooga
Chattanooga (Tenn.). Board of Education; United States. District Court (Tennessee: Eastern Division)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Mapp v. Board of Education briefs, memoranda, and legal documents, 1965-1967
Chattanooga Board of Education records and correspondence, 1965-1969
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Raymond B. Witt Chattanooga Public Schools desegregation records
